title: Personal Portfolio
tagline: The responsive, data-driven site you are viewing right now
desc: A modern portfolio website built with Flask. Features a JSON-driven content architecture for easy updates.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: A high-performance, data-driven portfolio website designed to serve as a centralized content management system. Unlike typical static site generators, this application uses a custom JSON-based architecture to decouple data from the presentation layer.

sections.title: The Problem
sections.content: Static HTML portfolios are difficult to maintain; updating a single project often requires editing multiple HTML files. I needed a lightweight, custom solution that demonstrated full-stack capability while remaining performant.

subsections.title: Architecture
subsections.content: The app follows a Model-View-Template (MVT) pattern. Flask handles the routing...

subsections.title: Frontend Logic
subsections.content: Using vanilla JavaScript for the magnetic cursor, intersections, and dynamic TOC drawing...

subsections.title: Data Layer
subsections.content: A flat-file JSON database acts as the single source of truth, allowing instant updates...

title: FamilyConnect
tagline: M.Sc. Final Project — Private social messaging prototype
desc: A private social feed for families with secure auth and image optimization.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: FamilyConnect is a private social networking prototype designed to simulate the core architecture of platforms like Facebook, but optimized for close-knit family groups with a focus on privacy. Public social networks monetize user data and expose family memories to the public internet.

content_items.title: Database Normalization
content_items.desc: Efficiently linking Users, Posts, and Comments (nested relationships) was critical. I had to carefully define Foreign Keys and indexing strategies to prevent N+1 query performance issues.

title: Workplace
tagline: M.Sc. Mini Project — Academic team workflow hub
desc: A centralized dashboard for student teams to manage tasks and documents.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Workplace is a collaborative task management hub designed specifically for academic teams. It solves the problem of fragmented communication by providing a single dashboard for tracking deadlines, sharing resources, and managing project milestones. Think of it as a simplified Trello or Asana.

title: Tic Tac Toe AI
tagline: Python graphics project with custom AI engine
desc: A graphical game built from scratch using Python Turtle with a custom AI.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: A graphical implementation of the classic Tic Tac Toe game, featuring a custom-built AI opponent. This project served as a deep study in game state management, heuristic algorithms, and rendering graphics using Python's Turtle module.

content_items.title: Coordinate Mapping
content_items.desc: The hardest part was translating pixel-perfect mouse clicks on the canvas (e.g., x=150, y=200) to the logical 3x3 game matrix (row=0, col=2) to update the internal state correctly.

title: Departmental Portal
tagline: B.Sc. Final Project — Digital notice board & CMS
desc: A digital portal for university faculty and students with a custom CMS.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: A comprehensive digital portal for the Computer Science department, developed to digitize the traditional notice board. It provides a CMS for faculty members to publish news and a responsive interface for students to access exam schedules, syllabus materials, and event announcements.

title: Watermark Studio
tagline: Python utility for batch image processing
desc: A desktop tool that applies transparent watermarks to images in bulk.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Watermark Studio is a desktop automation tool built to batch-process images. It allows photographers and content creators to apply transparent watermarks to hundreds of photos in seconds, preserving metadata and quality.

title: Snake Game
desc: A study in game loop architecture and collision detection algorithms.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: A faithful recreation of the classic arcade Snake game. This project explores the fundamentals of game development, including the main game loop, collision detection algorithms, and real-time user input handling.

content_items.title: Input Latency (The Suicide Bug)
content_items.desc: If a player pressed 'Down' then 'Left' faster than one game tick, the snake would turn into itself and die immediately. I solved this by buffering input commands.
